titleHead: Cookie Policy - Appeal a benefit decision - GOV.UK

cookies.title: Cookie Policy
cookies.description: The ‘submit your appeal’ website stores small files (known as cookies), on your computer. They are used to improve your experience of using the website.

list: measure how you use the website so it can be updated and improved based on your needs
remember the notifications you’ve seen so that we don’t show them to you again
description: Cookies on the ‘submit your appeal’ website aren’t used to identify you personally.
You’ll normally see a message on the site before we store a cookie on your computer.

howAreTheyUsed.title: How cookies are used
howAreTheyUsed.subtitle: Measuring website usage (Google Analytics)
howAreTheyUsed.description: We use Google Analytics software to collect information about how you use GOV.UK. We do this to help make sure the site is meeting the needs of its users and to help us make improvements, e.g.

list: how long you spend on each GOV.UK page
how you got to the submit your appeal site
what you click on while you’re visiting the site
description: We don’t collect or store your personal information (e.g. your name or address) so this information can’t be used to identify who you are.
We don’t allow Google to use or share our analytics data.
Google Analytics sets the following cookies:

items.name: _ga
items.purpose: This helps us count how many people visit GOV.UK by tracking if you’ve visited before

items.name: _gat
items.purpose: Used to manage the rate at which page view requests are made

items.name: _utma
items.purpose: Like _ga, this lets us know if you’ve visited before, so we can count how many of our visitors are new to GOV.UK or to a certain page

items.name: _utmb
items.purpose: This works with _utmc to calculate the average length of time you spend on GOV.UK

items.name: _utmc
items.purpose: This works with _utmb to calculate when you close your browser

items.name: _utmz
items.purpose: This tells us how you reached GOV.UK (e.g. from another website or a search engine)

items.name: analytics_next_page_call
items.purpose: This lets us know the next page you visit on GOV.UK, so we can make journeys better

items.name: govuk_contact_referrer
items.purpose: This lets us know the last page you visited before using the contact GOV.UK form

ourIntroductoryMessage.title: Our introductory message
ourIntroductoryMessage.description: You may see a pop-up welcome message when you first visit GOV.UK. We’ll store a cookie so that your computer knows you’ve seen it and knows not to show it again.

items.name: seen_cookie_message
items.purpose: Saves a message to let us know that you’ve seen our cookie message
